intro: Eutacta cookii var. viridis, commonly known as the green-leaved rock fig, is a rare and unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its succulent, thick, and fleshy leaves that are typically a vibrant green. The plant produces small, clustered fruit that is edible and has a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
